form.name: aspnetForm

li.span: HSD schools are closed for the rest of the school year. Click here for more information.

div.label: Translate Page

div.div: HSD Schools are closed for the rest of the school year. Student learning will continue at home!

For news about this closure, click here.
For at-home learning resources, nutritional and child care services & more, click here.

div.span: Posted On: Thursday, April 16, 2020
This Friday night, the district will be turning on the HHS stadium lights to honor the Class of 2020 as part of the #BeTheLight initiative.

a.title: Click to read more about: #BeTheLight this Friday Night!

div.a: Teachers & staff read to students during closure
div.span: Posted On: Friday, April 10, 2020
To help our students stay connected to school, HHES teachers & staff are sitting down in front of the camera to share some of their favorite ...

a.title: Click to read more about: Teachers & staff read to students during closure

div.a: Online kindergarten sign-up coming this month
div.span: Posted On: Wednesday, April 8, 2020
The district will unveil a new online registration process for incoming kindergarten students ('20-'21) later this month.

a.title: Click to read more about: Online kindergarten sign-up coming this month

div.a: Schools closed for rest of 19-20 school year
div.span: Posted On: Saturday, April 4, 2020
The latest information from the district following the Governor's decision to close schools for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year.

a.title: Click to read more about: Schools closed for rest of 19-20 school year

div.a: Doing your part: Stay home, stay healthy
div.span: Posted On: Thursday, March 26, 2020
The sooner we hunker down, the sooner we can get through this together.

a.title: Click to read more about: Doing your part: Stay home, stay healthy

div.span: Posted On: Saturday, March 14, 2020
Find school closure updates, frequently asked questions and coronavirus information and resources here.

a.title: Click to read more about: Coronavirus school closure: Updates & information

div.a: Custodial staff steps up cleaning efforts
div.span: Posted On: Sunday, March 1, 2020
Learn about the preventative action being taken by Hockinson School Districts custodial staff in response to the coronavirus.

a.title: Click to read more about: Custodial staff steps up cleaning efforts

div.a: Free drop-in program now available for kids 0-5
div.span: Posted On: Friday, December 20, 2019
1-2-3 Grow & Learn Group is now offered at the former Hockinson Middle School building on Thursdays.

a.title: Click to read more about: Free drop-in program now available for kids 0-5

div.a: District teams up with Clark PUD to save energy
div.span: Posted On: Thursday, December 5, 2019
The District has embarked on a new effort to save by participating in an energy conservation program with Clark PUD.

a.title: Click to read more about: District teams up with Clark PUD to save energy

div.a: 100 victories: Football players honor coach Steele
div.span: Posted On: Friday, October 18, 2019
The football players at Hockinson High School mark a special achievement by head coach Rick Steele: 100 victories!

a.title: Click to read more about: 100 victories: Football players honor coach Steele

div.a: Applications open for free/reduced meal programs
div.span: Posted On: Monday, September 16, 2019
Eligible families interested in free and reduced-price meal programs at school are now able to apply for participation at any time during the year.

a.title: Click to read more about: Applications open for free/reduced meal programs

blockquote.style: background:#FFF; border:0; border-radius:3px; box-shadow:0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width:540px; min-width:326px; padding:0; width:99.375%; width:-webkit-calc(100% - 2px); width:calc(100% - 2px);

a.style: background:#FFFFFF; line-height:0; padding:0 0; text-align:center; text-decoration:none; width:100%;

div.style: display: flex; flex-direction: row; align-items: center;
background-color: #F4F4F4; border-radius: 50%; flex-grow: 0; height: 40px; margin-right: 14px; width: 40px;
display: flex; flex-direction: column; flex-grow: 1; justify-content: center;
background-color: #F4F4F4; border-radius: 4px; flex-grow: 0; height: 14px; margin-bottom: 6px; width: 100px;
color:#3897f0; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:550; line-height:18px;
display: flex; flex-direction: row; margin-bottom: 14px; align-items: center;
background-color: #F4F4F4; border-radius: 50%; height: 12.5px; width: 12.5px; transform: translateX(0px) translateY(7px);
background-color: #F4F4F4; height: 12.5px; transform: rotate(-45deg) translateX(3px) translateY(1px); width: 12.5px; flex-grow: 0; margin-right: 14px; margin-left: 2px;
background-color: #F4F4F4; border-radius: 50%; height: 12.5px; width: 12.5px; transform: translateX(9px) translateY(-18px);
width: 0; height: 0; border-top: 2px solid transparent; border-left: 6px solid #f4f4f4; border-bottom: 2px solid transparent; transform: translateX(16px) translateY(-4px) rotate(30deg)
width: 0px; border-top: 8px solid #F4F4F4; border-right: 8px solid transparent; transform: translateY(16px);
background-color: #F4F4F4; flex-grow: 0; height: 12px; width: 16px; transform: translateY(-4px);
width: 0; height: 0; border-top: 8px solid #F4F4F4; border-left: 8px solid transparent; transform: translateY(-4px) translateX(8px);
display: flex; flex-direction: column; flex-grow: 1; justify-content: center; margin-bottom: 24px;
background-color: #F4F4F4; border-radius: 4px; flex-grow: 0; height: 14px; margin-bottom: 6px; width: 224px;

p.style: color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;

div.p: A post shared by Hockinson Schools (@hockinsonschools) on Apr 17, 2020 at 1:10pm PDT
Our vision is to inspire all to live with strong core values, to become competent, responsible learners, independent thinkers, and positive contributors to our changing world.

h1.span: If you are unable to access any information provided on this website, please contact the Hockinson District Office by phone at (360) 448-6400. To reach us via fax, dial (360) 448-6409.
